items.title: Ironwood is Google’s newest AI accelerator chip
Google’s newest Gemini AI model focuses on efficiency
Google Workspace gets automation flows, podcast-style summaries
Google’s enterprise cloud gets a music-generating AI model
Gemini Code Assist, Google’s AI coding assistant, gets ‘agentic’ abilities
Samsung adds Google’s Gemini to its home robot Ballie
Reddit’s conversational AI search tool leverages Google Gemini
Lyst, the fashion marketplace once valued at $700M, sells to Japan’s Zozo for $154M
Governments identify dozens of Android apps bundled with spyware
A 25-year-old police drone founder just raised $75M led by Index
items.author: Charles Rollet
items.summary:
- Brinc Drones, founded by 25-year-old Blake Resnick, raised $75 million led by Index Ventures on April 8, 2025.
- Total funding for Brinc now stands at $157.2 million; the startup had a valuation of $300 million in 2023.
- New funds will help launch a strategic alliance with Motorola Solutions to enhance 911 response with drones.
- Brinc's drones aim to reach hard-to-access areas faster than police cruisers, addressing public safety needs.
- Competing with U.S. startups like Flock Safety and Skydio, which have substantial valuations in the drone sector.

items.title: Instagram is beefing up its search to compete with TikTok
items.author: Sarah Perez
items.summary:
- Instagram’s head Adam Mosseri announced the company is improving its search functionality to better compete with TikTok.
- Instagram is acknowledging the need for a stronger search feature, especially to attract Gen Z users who prefer social apps for search over traditional engines.
- Meta has bolstered the team responsible for search improvements, aiming to enhance content discovery.
- Studies show a significant shift among Gen Z toward using Instagram as their preferred search engine, where they prioritize short-form video content.
- Upcoming changes to Instagram include better integration of comments into the search function to enhance discovery of relevant content.

items.title: Deep Cogito emerges from stealth with hybrid AI ‘reasoning’ models
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- Deep Cogito has launched with hybrid AI models that can switch between reasoning and non-reasoning modes.
- These models, called Cogito 1, utilize a combination of reasoning and non-reasoning components for performance.
- Cogito 1 has been internally benchmarked to outperform existing models in mathematics and language tasks.
- Models range from 3 billion to 70 billion parameters, with future models expected to reach 671 billion parameters.
- The company's founders are Drishan Arora and Dhruv Malhotra, who have backgrounds at Google AI and DeepMind.
- Models are available for download or use via APIs on providers Fireworks AI and Together AI.

items.title: No, Stripe is not becoming a bank
items.author: Mary Ann Azevedo
items.summary:
- Stripe has applied for a narrow U.S. banking license but will not function as a bank.  
- This license will allow Stripe to process its own payments without accepting deposits.  
- Approval for the banking license could occur by the third quarter of 2025.  
- The move is aimed at reducing dependency on external partners for payment processing.

items.title: Inside the EV startup secretly backed by Jeff Bezos
MrBeast Comments on Trump's Tariff Plans and Their Impact on Businesses
items.author: Amanda Silberling
items.summary:
- MrBeast, a prominent YouTuber, discusses the implications of Trump's proposed tariffs on imports.
- He highlights how tariffs negatively affect his company, Feastables, suggesting it's cheaper to manufacture abroad rather than in the U.S.
- MrBeast emphasizes the importance of sourcing cocoa internationally due to the nature of agricultural production.
- He expresses concern for small businesses that may struggle under the burden of tariffs.

items.title: Does Colossal Biosciences’ dire wolf creation justify its $10B+ valuation?
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Colossal Biosciences announced the creation of a genetically modified dire wolf, targeting de-extinction of an animal extinct for over 12,000 years.
- The dire wolves are living on a secretive 2,000-acre preserve and are derived from genes of ancient fossils.
- The company claims this to be the first extinct species brought back to life through genetically edited gray wolves, resulting in a hybrid appearance.
- Scientists express skepticism, suggesting the project represents gene modification rather than true de-extinction.
- The company's potential business prospects are discussed, including collaborations in conservation and artificial womb technology usage.

items.title: A nonprofit is using AI agents to raise money for charity
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- Sage Future, a nonprofit, is using AI models to raise money for charity.
- Four AI models, including OpenAI's GPT-4o and Anthropic’s Claude models, raised $257 for Helen Keller International in one week.
- The AI agents are not fully autonomous and took suggestions from human spectators, who provided most of the donations.
- Agents coordinated via group chat, created Google Docs, and handled social media promotion.
- Challenges included technical hurdles and distractions, but plans for future improvements include testing new models and agency setups.

items.title: Tapestry’s app can now de-dupe your social feeds
items.author: Sarah Perez
items.summary:
- Tapestry app adds a feature called Crosstalk to remove duplicate posts from social feeds.
- The feature rolls out with Tapestry 1.1 iOS update, available starting Tuesday.
- Tapestry was created by the team behind Twitterific, emphasizing user control over social media.
- Users can now track posts from multiple platforms like Bluesky, Mastodon, and more.
- Crosstalk can detect duplicates even with variations in text length or content.
- New features include Quicklinks for easy navigation between timelines and enhanced feed customization.
- Tapestry is free with in-app purchases; subscriptions are $1.99 monthly or $19.99 yearly.

items.title: Google fixes two Android zero-day bugs actively exploited by hackers
items.author: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
items.summary:
- Google released an Android update addressing two zero-day flaws that were potentially exploited by hackers.
- The vulnerabilities include CVE-2024-53197, identified by Amnesty International, which was exploited against a Serbian student activist.
- The second vulnerability, CVE-2024-53150, is less documented but involves a critical security flaw in the kernel, with potential for remote privilege escalation without user interaction.
- Patches for the vulnerabilities will be pushed within 48 hours; Android partners were notified a month in advance.

items.title: Take the stage at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025: Apply to speak now
Amazon’s Zoox begins robotaxi testing in Los Angeles
items.author: Rebecca Bellan
items.summary:
- Zoox initiates testing of a small fleet of retrofitted vehicles in Los Angeles starting April 8, 2025.
- The deployment includes manually driven Toyota Highlanders equipped with self-driving technology to collect mapping data.
- Zoox aims for broader autonomous testing in LA this summer and currently tests its vehicles in multiple cities including San Francisco and Las Vegas.
- The initiative comes after Zoox's recall of 258 vehicles due to issues with unexpected hard braking.
- Waymo currently offers paid robotaxi rides in LA, while Zoox is still in early testing stages.

items.title: Los Angeles-based Rain raised a $75M Series B in another good sign for fintech
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Rain, a fintech startup, raised $75 million in a Series B round led by Prosus, achieving a valuation of $340 million.
- The funds will support the addition of credit card and savings products to its offerings.
- Rain provides earned wage access (EWA) solutions with financial wellness features; about 2.5 million employees are now using its services, distributing over $2 billion in wages.
- The company plans to launch new products including an EWA-secured credit card and features to facilitate Health Savings Account usage by the end of 2025.
- Rain aims to differentiate itself by offering financial education, one-on-one coaching, and tax filing services, with 70% of adoption from these non-EWA services.
- In 2023, Rain raised $116 million in a Series A funding round, with $66 million in equity and $50 million in debt.

items.title: Founders, TechCrunch Startup Battlefield 200 is calling! Apply to enter!
items.summary:
- Applications for the **Startup Battlefield 200** are now open as of **April 8, 2025**.
- Startups can compete for **$100,000 equity-free** and significant exposure alongside 199 other presenters.
- Application deadline is **June 9, 2025**; only **200 startups** will be selected to compete, with **20 pitching on stage**.
- Participants receive benefits including a free exhibit space, complimentary tickets, and access to investor-led masterclasses.
- Notable previous contestants have included **Trello**, **Dropbox**, and **Discord**.

items.title: Trump to endorse coal for data center power in the face of grim market realities
items.author: Tim De Chant
items.summary:
- President Trump is set to sign an executive order to boost the coal industry.
- The order will classify coal as a critical mineral and require some coal-fired plants to remain operational.
- Coal's electricity generation share has declined from 51% in 2001 to about 15% now, largely due to low-cost natural gas and renewables.
- Coal is highly polluting, contributing to numerous environmental and health issues, including mercury poisoning.
- The administration may find more success in promoting metallurgical coal for steel production, despite cheaper renewable options.

items.title: Volunteer your time for a free ticket to TechCrunch Sessions: AI
Waymo may use interior camera data to train generative AI models, but riders will be able to opt out
Meet the new Audience Choice winners to lead breakouts at TechCrunch Sessions: AI
Mira Murati’s AI startup gains prominent ex-OpenAI advisers
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- Mira Murati’s AI venture, [Thinking Machines Lab](https://techcrunch.com/2025/02/18/thinking-machines-lab-is-ex-openai-cto-mira-muratis-new-startup/), gained advisers Bob McGrew and Alec Radford, both former OpenAI officials.
- McGrew was previously OpenAI’s chief research officer and Radford a researcher instrumental in OpenAI's generative pre-trained transformers (GPT) development.
- Thinking Machines Lab plans to create AI tools that cater to individual needs, with a vague research agenda so far.

items.title: Mira Murati’s AI startup gains prominent ex-OpenAI advisors
Snapchat rolls out Sponsored AI Lenses for brands
items.author: Aisha Malik
items.summary:
- Snapchat introduces Sponsored AI Lenses, allowing brands to engage users with AI-generated experiences.
- AI Lenses enable interactive user experiences, integrating personal selfies into various AI-generated scenes.
- The company claims users spend more time with Sponsored AI Lenses compared to traditional formats, with brands like Tinder and Uber already utilizing this feature.

items.title: Amazon unveils a new AI voice model, Nova Sonic
items.author: Maxwell Zeff
items.summary:
- Amazon launched Nova Sonic, a new generative AI voice model that processes and generates natural-sounding speech.
- Nova Sonic is said to compete with models from OpenAI and Google in speed and conversational quality.
- The model is available through Amazon's Bedrock platform and is 80% less expensive than OpenAI's GPT-4o.
- It improves upon older models by generating text transcripts and handling real-time queries efficiently.
- Nova Sonic achieved a 4.2% word error rate across multiple languages, outperforming competitors in accuracy and speed.
- The model is part of Amazon's strategy for developing artificial general intelligence (AGI).

items.title: Blackbird gobbles up $50M for its blockchain-based payment-loyalty app for restaurants
items.author: Ingrid Lunden
items.summary:
- Blackbird Labs has raised $50 million to enhance its blockchain-based payment-loyalty platform for restaurants.
- The startup aims to launch a cross-restaurant loyalty service called Blackbird Club and expand into new markets beyond New York, San Francisco, and Charleston.
- Led by Spark Capital, the funding round includes support from Coinbase Ventures, Amex Ventures, and Andreessen Horowitz.
- Blackbird has signed up around 1,000 restaurants and has raised a total of $85 million to date.
- The platform is designed to save restaurants 3-4% in payment processing fees.

items.title: XL Batteries is using petrochemical infrastructure to store solar and wind power
items.author: Tim De Chant
items.summary:
- XL Batteries has developed a new battery technology that is cheaper, safer, and more durable than existing batteries.
- The company targets grid-scale storage, using bulkier and heavier liquid to store electricity.
- They are commissioning a demonstration unit at Stolthaven Terminals, aiming for large-scale battery systems capable of powering around 25,000 homes for a day.
- XL Batteries is leveraging flow battery technology, which uses two tanks and pumps for energy storage.
- Their technology is based on stable organic compounds that were previously difficult to use effectively.
- The company plans to work with independent power producers in Texas for grid support installations.

items.title: Sizl raises $3.5M to expand its cook-to-order food delivery service
items.author: Lauren Forristal
items.summary:
- Sizl announced a $3.5 million seed funding round at a $12 million valuation.
- The company focuses on delivering fresh meals made in-house, with a menu emphasizing Eastern European cuisine, including 60 items like chicken kyiv and pierogies.
- Sizl operates its own kitchens with a small team and has a mobile app for engaging customers with rewards and cash back.
- Funding will be used to expand to four additional kitchens in Chicago and explore markets in Boston, Charlotte, and the San Francisco Bay Area.

items.title: Meta introduces restricted Teen Accounts to Facebook and Messenger
items.author: Aisha Malik
items.summary:
- Meta introduces Teen Accounts on Facebook and Messenger, aimed at protecting young users.
- The feature limits inappropriate content and unwanted contact, requiring parental permission for settings changes for users under 16.
- Teen Accounts initially launched on Instagram and have seen 54 million teens enrolled, with positive feedback from parents about their usefulness.

items.title: Turkey’s Sipay raises $78M to expand its Stripe-like services into emerging markets
items.author: Mike Butcher
items.summary:
- Sipay raised $78 million in Series B funding, achieving a valuation of $875 million.
- The funds will be used to expand into markets outside of Turkey and introduce services like remittances.
- Led by Elephant VC, the funding round included participation from QuantumLight, founded by a co-founder of Revolut.
- Founded in 2019, Sipay operates an all-in-one app for digital wallets, investments, and other fintech solutions.
- The company has 6.3 million wallet users and 25,000 registered merchants, reporting profitable growth since 2023.
- Sipay’s focus on cross-border payments aims to drive international growth, as stated by board member Peter Fallon.

items.title: Apple might import more iPhones from India to side-step China tariffs
items.summary:
- Apple is considering importing more iPhones from India due to 54% tariffs on goods from China announced by the U.S. government.
- This strategy is a short-term measure while Apple negotiates for tariff exemptions and waits to revamp its supply chain.
- The proposed tariffs from India are 26%, which could significantly impact the price of the iPhone 16 Pro if imports from China continue.
- Apple plans to make 25 million iPhones in India this year, potentially fulfilling 50% of U.S. market demand if all units are imported.

items.title: IBM releases a new mainframe built for the age of AI
items.author: Becca Szkutak
items.summary:
- IBM announced the release of the z17 mainframe, designed to accelerate AI adoption.
- The z17 is powered by an IBM Telum II processor and supports over 250 AI use cases.
- It can process 450 billion inference operations daily, a 50% increase from the previous z16 model.
- The development of the z17 took five years, aligning with market trends towards AI since late 2022.
- The mainframe will support 48 IBM Spyre AI accelerator chips at launch, with plans to double that within a year.
- The z17 is more energy-efficient than its predecessor and competitors, increasing AI acceleration by 7.5 times with lower energy use.
- General availability is set for June 8, 2025.

items.title: Google is allegedly paying some AI staff to do nothing for a year rather than join rivals
items.summary:
- Google’s AI division, DeepMind, uses aggressive noncompete agreements for some staff in the U.K.
- These agreements prevent employees from working for competitors for up to a year while being compensated during this period.
- The practice is causing frustration among AI researchers who feel isolated from industry advancements.
- Noncompete clauses were banned in the U.S. by the FTC last year but do not apply to DeepMind’s London office.
- Concerns about the noncompete clauses were echoed by the VP of AI at Microsoft, who reported inquiries from distressed DeepMind staff.

items.title: Microsoft reportedly fires staff whose protest interrupted its Copilot event
items.summary:
- On April 7, 2025, Microsoft reportedly terminated two software engineers, Ibtihal Aboussad and Vaniya Agrawal, following their protest during the Copilot event.
- Aboussad interrupted Microsoft AI CEO Mustafa Suleyman, accusing him of having "blood on his hands," while Agrawal shouted at a panel including CEO Satya Nadella and Bill Gates for Microsoft to cut ties with Israel.
- The internal message from Microsoft indicated that the employees should have raised concerns privately rather than disrupting the event.

items.title: Amazon says its AI video model can now generate minutes-long clips
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- Amazon upgraded its AI video model, Nova Reel, to generate videos up to two minutes long.
- Nova Reel can create "multi-shot" videos with consistent styles; users can provide prompts up to 4,000 characters.
- A new mode, "Multishot Manual," allows referencing images for better video composition.
- Nova Reel is available through AWS services, and its training data source has not been disclosed, raising IP concerns.

items.title: How one tweet wreaked havoc on the stock market
items.author: Amanda Silberling
items.summary:
- A false tweet from Walter Bloomberg suggested President Trump was considering a 90-day pause on tariffs, causing market volatility.
- The erroneous report led to significant fluctuations in index funds like the Dow Jones before being retracted.
- The White House quickly denied the statements attributed to its economic adviser Kevin Hassett, who has not made such claims.
- Reuters and CNBC later acknowledged their roles in propagating the misinformation, with Reuters retracting its original report.

items.title: Nikola founder Trevor Milton wants to buy the bankrupt startup’s assets
items.author: Sean O'Kane
items.summary:
• Trevor Milton, founder of Nikola, seeks to purchase his former company's assets from bankruptcy.
• Nikola filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy in February, aiming to sell its business by mid-April.
• Milton's bid faced opposition; he was denied access to inspect factory assets.
• He was recently pardoned after serving time for securities fraud.
• An auction for Nikola's assets is scheduled for April 7 to determine the highest offer.

items.title: Flexport CEO Ryan Petersen’s high-stakes test amid tariff turmoil: ‘You can’t be freaking out’
items.summary:
- Ryan Petersen, CEO of Flexport, addressed over 2,300 customers following President Trump’s new tariffs defined as “Liberation Day.”
- The tariffs could reach up to 79% on various products from China, significantly impacting U.S. importers and port operations.
- The closure of the de minimis program for global imports affects many e-commerce businesses now subject to new customs obligations.
- Petersen had already engaged with 200 customers before the tariff announcement, expecting duties on diverse locations including Vietnam.
- Flexport aims to provide stability and guidance to clients amidst tariff chaos, with Petersen emphasizing the need for calm leadership during crises.
- Future disruptions include proposed port fees for ships made in China, predicted to increase costs for U.S. importers.
- Petersen indicated ongoing negotiations with countries like Vietnam and Israel may lead to reciprocal trade agreements shortly.

items.title: Meta exec denies the company artificially boosted Llama 4’s benchmark scores
items.author: Ahmad Al-Dahle
items.summary:
- Meta's VP of generative AI, Ahmad Al-Dahle, denied accusations of artificially boosting Llama 4's benchmark scores.
- Rumors originated from a user on a Chinese social media site, claiming to have resigned from Meta due to its benchmarking practices.
- Reports indicated that Llama 4 models perform poorly on certain tasks, exacerbating skepticism about their capabilities.

items.title: Analyst says Apple, Tesla have biggest exposure to Trump’s tariffs
items.author: Rebecca Bellan
items.summary:
- Wedbush Securities analyst Dan Ives reduced price targets for Apple and Tesla due to President Trump’s tariffs.
- Ives stated that Apple is most negatively affected, with 90% of iPhones produced in China, lowering its target by $75 to $250.
- Tesla's price target cut from $550 to $315, citing not only tariffs but also CEO Elon Musk's political associations impacting sales.

items.title: Former Tesla exec Drew Baglino’s new startup is rethinking the electrical transformer
items.author: Tim De Chant
items.summary:
- Former Tesla executive Drew Baglino has founded Heron Power, focusing on solid-state transformers for the electric grid.
- The startup aims to raise between $30 million to $50 million for its Series A funding round, with Capricorn Investment Group leading.
- Baglino previously worked at Tesla since 2006, and left the company in April 2024 during staff layoffs.
- Solid-state transformers offer improved regulation for voltage dips from renewable sources and feature a more compact design.
- Heron Power is one of several startups targeting the transformer market, competing with Singapore-based Amperesand.

items.title: Waymo may use interior camera data to train generative AI models, sell ads
items.author: Rebecca Bellan
items.summary:
- Waymo plans to use data from robotaxis, including video from interior cameras tied to rider identities, for training generative AI models.
- The unreleased privacy policy indicates data may also be shared for personalized ads.
- Riders can opt out of sharing their information under California privacy laws, but concern rises over data use for AI training and marketing.
- The company records over 200,000 paid robotaxi rides weekly in cities like Los Angeles and San Francisco.
- Waymo seeks new revenue streams through advertising and data sharing, amid significant financial losses for Alphabet.

items.title: Google’s AI Mode now lets users ask complex questions about images
items.author: Aisha Malik
items.summary:
- Google introduces multimodal search in AI Mode, allowing complex, multi-part questions on images.
- Powered by Google Lens, it analyzes entire scenes in photos, understanding relationships and details.
- Users can upload or take photos and ask personalized questions, receiving specific recommendations.
- The feature will be available to a larger audience in Google Labs, previously limited to Google One AI Premium subscribers.
- Launched in March 2025, AI Mode aims to compete with services like ChatGPT Search.

items.title: Shopify CEO tells teams to consider using AI before growing headcount
items.author: Lauren Forristal
items.summary:
- Shopify CEO Tobi Lütke implemented a policy requiring teams to justify why AI cannot be used before requesting additional headcount.
- Lütke encourages teams to envision their projects with autonomous AI agents to spark creative solutions.
- This approach aligns with a trend where CEOs like Klarna's Sebastian Siemiatkowski leverage AI to reduce workforce size, with potential job disruptions highlighted by a UN report stating AI could affect over 40% of global roles.
- Shopify had approximately 8,100 employees as of 2024, following significant layoffs in previous years, including a 20% staff reduction in 2023.
